column4: Apple faces $400 mln in damages in university patent case - sources
column5: Oct 14 - Apple's potential damages in a patent fight with the University of Wisconsin's licensing body could reach $400 million as a trial on the amount Apple owes for infringing a processor patent got under way on Wednesday  two people familiar with the case said.

column4: Apple faces $400 million in damages in university patent case: sources
column5: NEW YORK Apple's potential damages in a patent fight with the University of Wisconsin's licensing body could reach $400 million as a trial on the amount Apple owes for infringing a processor patent got under way on Wednesday  two people familiar with the case said.

column4: Apple faces $400 mln in damages in university patent case - sources
column5: NEW YORK  Oct 14 Apple's potential damages in a patent fight with the University of Wisconsin's licensing body could reach $400 million as a trial on the amount Apple owes for infringing a processor patent got under way on Wednesday  two people familiar with the case said.

column4: Apple loses patent lawsuit to Univ. of Wisconsin  faces hefty damages
column5: Oct 14 - Apple Inc could be facing up to $862 million in damages after a U.S. jury on Tuesday found the iPhone maker used technology owned by the University of Wisconsin-Madison's licensing arm without permission in chips found in many of its most popular devices.

column4: UK firm appeals to digital music refuseniks with Jukebox service
column5: LONDON  Oct 14 A British start-up has launched a music streaming service dubbed the Electric Jukebox that  for an annual fee  plugs into the back of a television for music fans who do not want to fiddle with app-based monthly subscription services.

column4: European shares little changed  ASML slides on results
column5: MILAN  Oct 14 European shares were little changed on Wednesday with gains capped by new concerns about deflationary pressures in China  while technology group ASML and builder Skanska slid after weak business updates.

column4: European shares fall on weak China data  ASML slides after results
column5: LONDON/MILAN  Oct 14 European shares fell for a third day on Wednesday as new concerns about deflationary pressures in China hit equity markets  while technology group ASML and builder Skanska slid after weak business updates.

column4: BlackRock profit falls in third quarter but tops expectations
column5: NEW YORK Investors piled into BlackRock Inc  bond ETFs and paid more in hedge fund fees in the third quarter  helping the world's largest asset manager beat Wall Street's earnings forecasts and offsetting a higher tax hit that cut profits 8 percent from a year earlier.

column4: UPDATE 3-BlackRock profit falls in 3rd qtr but tops expectations
column5: (Adds dateline  recasts  CEO and analyst quote  stock quote)     By Trevor Hunnicutt     NEW YORK  Oct 14 Investors piled into BlackRock Inc bond ETFs and paid more in hedge fund fees in the third quarter  helping the world's largest asset manager beat Wall Street's earnings forecasts and offsetting a higher tax hit that cut profits 8 percent from a year earlier.     Rough-and-tumble markets saw BlackRock trim core investment advice and administration fees by $12 million from 2014

column4: BlackRock's profit falls 8 pct
